intro: Hieracium praecurrens subsp. pelesii, commonly known as the Pelesii hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has a low-growing habit with slender, hairy stems and basal leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and floral characteristics compared to other Hieracium species.
